Sentence.sentence: To match the growing demand, services are springing up to make it easier to publish research products online and enable other researchers to discover and cite them.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: One Chicago woman, for example, discovered that daily lunches with coworkers cost her 2,000 dollars a year.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: After making inquiries Hughes discovered that they were being composed on computers, then just finding their way into British homes.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Ted Hughes discovered many long poems submitted for poetry competition were composed on computers
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Indeed, the Obama effect can be surprisingly immediate and powerful, as Ray Friedman of Vanderbilt University and his colleagues discovered.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: If scholars suddenly discovered that Rembrandt had dashed off "The Night Watch" in an afternoon, it would still be "The Night Watch
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: All the causes of the sickness are not discovered yet.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Russell Fazio, an Ohio State psychology professor who has studied interracial roommates there and at Indiana University, discovered an intriguing academic effect.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The German authorities are sending investigators to discover the cause of the plane crash late yesterday on the island of Tenerife.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The extreme isolation of these massive farms leaves them often unattended, and monitored only once or twice a year, which means if the livestock falls ill or requires assistance, it can be a long time for farmers to discover.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"发现"之意。
means: discover ： 普通用词，指发现本来存在，但示被认识的事物、真理或情况。
find ： 普通用词，可指偶然发现，也可指经过寻找后得到或重新获得已失去的东西。强调动作的结果。
detect ： 正式用词，强调经过周密观察或研究而有所获得和发现，尤指发现有意隐藏之物。
ascertain ： 较正式用词，指有意搜寻与发现。

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"分开,分离,去掉"; 2. 表示"否定,不,消失掉"

stems_affixes.word_buile: dis否定,不,消失掉+graceful优美的→adj.可耻的, 不名誉的
dis否定,不,消失掉+honest诚实的→adj.不诚实的
dis否定,不,消失掉+incline愿意→adj.不愿的
dis否定,不,消失掉+passionate有激情的→adj.平心静气的
dis否定,不,消失掉+solute溶解→溶解开来→没有限制→放荡的
dis否定,不,消失掉+son声音+ant……的→声音不[好听]
dis分开,分离,去掉+cern搞清,确定+ment表名词→确定不同之处→有眼光

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不利, 不利条件, 缺点, 劣势
stems_affixes.word_buile: dis否定,不,消失掉+advantage优点,有利条件→n.不利, 不利条件, 缺点, 劣势
dis不+gust美味→n. 厌恶,恶心 v. 使厌恶
dis否定,不,消失掉+honour尊敬→毫无尊敬→丢脸
dis否定,不,消失掉+may能→不能做事→沮丧;参考:五月能种粮食,所以叫May
dis否定,不,消失掉+order顺序→没有顺序
dis否定,不,消失掉+proof证实→不证实→反证
dis分开,分离,去掉+course课程,教程→分解课程→论述→论文
dis分开+play=ply重叠→打开折叠→显示出来
dis分开,分离,去掉+affect感情→感情分开→疏远
dis分开,分离,去掉+burse钱包→从钱包中分出→支出
dis分开,分离,去掉+crimin分辨→ate→分辩开
dis分开,分离,去掉+cuss敲打→把[问题]分开敲→讨论
dis分开,分离,去掉+miss送→分开送出→解散
dis分开,分离,去掉+part部分→分成部分→分开
dis分开,分离,去掉+pens花费+e→分开花费→分配[财富等]
dis分开,分离,去掉+semin种子+ate表动词→散布[种子]
dis分开,分离,去掉+tend伸展,拉→分开伸展→膨胀
dis分开,分离,去掉+tract拉→把[心]拉开→分心
dis不+adapt使适应→v.使不适应
dis否定,不,消失掉+appear出现→不出现→消失
dis否定,不,消失掉+arm武装→去掉武装
dis否定,不,消失掉+courage勇气→v.使失去勇气
dis否定,不,消失掉+cover盖→把盖揭开→发现
dis不+gust美味→n. 厌恶,恶心 v. 使厌恶
dis否定,不,消失掉+honour尊敬→毫无尊敬→丢脸
dis否定,不,消失掉+like喜爱→不喜爱
dis否定,不,消失掉+organize组织→解散组织
dis否定,不,消失掉+pel推→推开→驱除

Sentence.sentence: After hours in the cold and wet, he reached inside and pulled the wallet out hoping to find some id so he could contact the driver,  only to discover it contained ￡400 in notes, with another ￡50 in spare change beside it.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语北京卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: And the story poses an interesting question: why do some people discover new vitality and creativity to the end of their days, while others go to seed long before?
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: At the university of Cambridge Turin discovered a wealth of important materials-including photographs, films, tape recordings, and field notes—which had remained unstudied and were badly in need of care and protection.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: But discovering freedom is not like discovering computers.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: But gold was discovered there in 1897, and two years later, it was one of the largest cities in the west, with a population of 30, 000.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷3 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: But now that information is being spread and monitored in different ways, researchers are discovering new rules.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷3 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: But recently it has discovered that data can be turned into new services: translation and visual recognition, to be sold to other companies.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: He came back in the late afternoon to discover that his suitcase was gone.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: He discovered that he could earn some money while doing something he really enjoyed.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷2 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: However doctor grand adds, that some people will hesitate, because they don't actually believe they can make it happen, while others will rush into downshifting to discover that their dream ends up with the financial crisis.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: However, I soon discover that much has changed since the days of disturbing reports of camps among tons of rubbish.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷I 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: I discovered even more about one of humanity's earliest forms of life art during several years of research around the world.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: I enjoyed, for instance, the chapter in which Harold discovers how to think on his own.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖北卷 阅读理解 阅读E 原文

Sentence.sentence: I myself went through this searching process and found something that has changed my experience at college for the better: I discovered asl-American sign language.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷1 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: I was excited by this new world that I had discovered.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: In advanced concepts and even philosophy—and they will soon discover that toknow feels more like a club than just a magazine.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: In ancient Egypt, a shopkeeper discovered that he could attract customers to his shop simply by making changes to its environment.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语重庆卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: It can be concluded from the passage that "patty poem" leads the writer to discover the power of poetry.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读A 题设

Sentence.sentence: It cannot be discovered once for all.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Little did I know that I would discover my love for ASL.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷1 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Luckily, I discovered the job—data analyst—this month and have been going full steam ahead.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Mari starts changing her life and discovers a world of diverse "night people" who are hiding secrets.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: My life improved remarkably when I discovered art.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读E 原文

Sentence.sentence: Only after talking to two students did I discover that having strong motivation is one of the biggest factors in reaching goals.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖南卷 单项选择 原文

Sentence.sentence: Outdoor adventure out take yourself out of your comfort zone for a week, discover new personal qualities, and learn new skills.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Researchers have discovered that "night milk" contains more melatonin, which has been proven to help people feel sleepy and reduce anxiety.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语四川卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: So, I was killing my time at home until June 2012 when I discovered the online computer courses of your training center.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Some 2, 500 years ago Greece discovered freedom.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: The intelligent transport team at newcastle university have turned an electric car into a mobile laboratory named "drivelab" in order to understand the challenges faced by older drivers and to discover where the key stress points are.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷3 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: The team discovered that some synapses seem to be protected and stayed the same size.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解  七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: The Winns soon discovered that daily hiking in their 50s is a lot harder than they remember it was in their 20s.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: When did Columbus discover the new world?
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: More recently, while examining housing construction, the researchers discovered that illiterate, non-English- speaking Mexican workers in Houston, Texas, consistently met best-practice labor productivity standards despite the complexity of the building industry’s work.
Sentence.come: 出自-2009年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But brain researchers have discovered that when we consciously develop new habits, we create parallel synaptic paths, and even entirely new brain cells, that can jump our trains of thought onto new, innovative tracks.
Sentence.come: 出自-2009年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Once a discovery claim becomes public, the discoverer receives intellectual credit.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Most archaeological sites, however, are discovered by archaeologists who have set out to look for them.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Most archaeological sites have been located by means of careful searching, while many others have been discovered by accident.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The first published sketch, “A Dinner at Poplar Walk” brought tears to Dickens’s eyes when he discovered it in the pages of The Monthly Magazine.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Failing at something can help you discover your truest friends, or help you find unexpected motivation to succeed.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语二）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: For instance, failure can help you discover how strong a person you are.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语二）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: The drive to discover is deeply rooted in humans, much the same as the basic drives for food or shelter, says Christopher Hsee of the University of Chicago.
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语二）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

sentences.en: Recently they have discovered a comet.
sentences.cn: 最近他们发现了一颗彗星。

sentences.en: I never discovered how to open the box.
sentences.cn: 我一直未能发现该如何打开这个箱子。

sentences.en: She discovered that she was being closely watched.
sentences.cn: 她发现她在被人监视。

sentences.en: We discovered her to be a good cook.
sentences.cn: 我们发现她是一个很好的厨师。

sentences.en: When returning back, he discovered the room to be in disorder.
sentences.cn: 回家后, 他发现屋子里乱七八糟。

sentences.en: They discovered him stealing public property.
sentences.cn: 他们发现他偷窃公共财产。

sentences.en: They discovered the murderer to have run away.
sentences.cn: 他们发现凶手已逃之夭夭。

sentences.en: He discovered what it was.
sentences.cn: 他看见它到底是什么了。

means.word_mean: 了解到, 认识到, 发觉

sentences.en: We'll discover who did it.
sentences.cn: 我们会查出是谁做的。

sentence.cn: 这个故事提出了一个有趣的问题：为什么有些人直到生命的最后一刻才发现新的活力和创造力，而有些人却早在很久以前就开始播种呢?
sentence.en: And the story poses an interesting question: why do some people discover new vitality and creativity to the end of their days,  while others go to seed long before?
sentence.from: 2019年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

sentence.cn: 然而，我很快就发现，自从那些有关“垃圾营帐”的报道之后，情况已经发生了很大的变化。
sentence.en: However,  I soon discover that much has changed since the days of disturbing reports of camps  among tons of rubbish.
sentence.from: 2019年高考英语全国卷I 完形填空 原文

entry.def: If you discover something that you did not know about before, you become aware of it or learn of it.
entry.tran: 发现(以前不知道的事实)

example.tran: 她发现他们已经逃跑了。

entry.def: If a person or thing is discovered, someone finds them, either by accident or because they have been looking for them.
entry.tran: (偶然)发现;找到(一直在寻找的某人或某物)

example.ex: A few days later his badly beaten body was discovered on a roadside outside the city.
example.tran: 几天后，他的尸体在城外的路边被发现，身上有被严重殴打过的痕迹。

entry.def: When someone discovers a new place, substance, scientific fact, or scientific technique, they are the first person to find it or become aware of it.

example.tran: 第一个发现美洲大陆的欧洲人

example.ex: In the 19th century, gold was discovered in California...
example.tran: 19 世纪时，在加利福尼亚发现了金子。

entry.def: If you say that someone has discovered a particular activity or subject, you mean that they have tried doing it or studying it for the first time and that they enjoyed it.
entry.tran: 初次接触(某活动并乐在其中)

example.ex: I wish I'd discovered photography when I was younger...
example.tran: 我要是早点接触到摄影技术就好了。

example.ex: Discover the delights and luxury of a private yacht.
example.tran: 体验私人游艇的乐趣和奢华。

entry.def: When an actor, musician, or other performer who is not well-known is discovered, someone recognizes that they have talent and helps them in their career.
entry.tran: 发现，发掘(不为人所知的演员、音乐人等艺人)

example.ex: The Beatles were discovered in the early 1960's.
example.tran: 甲壳虫乐队于20世纪60年代初为世人所知。

means.word_mean: 1. discover or determine the existence, presence, or fact of;

sentences.sentence: "She detected high levels of lead in her drinking water"
"We found traces of lead in the paint"

means.word_mean: 2. make a discovery, make a new finding;

sentences.sentence: "Physicists believe they found a new elementary particle"

means.word_mean: 3. get to know or become aware of, usually accidentally;

sentences.sentence: "I learned that she has two grown-up children"
"I see that you have been promoted"
"She found that he had lied to her"
"The story is false, so far as I can discover"
"the archeologists chanced upon an old tomb"
"The hikers finally struck the main path to the lake"

means.word_mean: 6. make known to the public information that was previously known only to a few people or that was meant to be kept a secret;

sentences.sentence: "The auction house would not disclose the price at which the van Gogh had sold"
"The actress won't reveal how old she is"

means.word_mean: 7. see for the first time; make a discovery;
8. identify as in botany or biology, for example

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'make known'): from Old French descovrir, from late Latin discooperire, from Latin dis- (expressing reversal) + cooperire 'cover completely' (see cover)

sentences.cn: 后来才了解到他患了重病。
sentences.en: He was later discovered to be seriously ill.

sentences.cn: 这个歌唱家在上学的时候就受到赏识了。
sentences.en: The singer was discovered while still at school.

sentences.cn: 青霉素的发现者
sentences.en: the discoverer of penicillin

sentences.cn: 后来查明这些日记是伪造的。
sentences.en: It was later discovered that the diaries were a fraud.

sentences.cn: 我们一直弄不清楚她为什么辞职。
sentences.en: We never did discover why she gave up her job.

sentences.cn: 得知他不识字真令人震惊。
sentences.en: It was a shock to discover (that) he couldn't read.

sentences.cn: 我刚知道有悬挂式滑翔运动！
sentences.en: I've just discovered hang-gliding!

sentences.cn: 人们发现她死在利兹她的家里。
sentences.en: She was discovered dead at her home in Leeds.

sentences.cn: 人们发现他原来藏在棚屋里。
sentences.en: He was discovered hiding in a shed.

sentences.cn: 我们在围绕这个海岛航行时发现了这个海滩。
sentences.en: We discovered this beach while we were sailing around the island.

sentences.cn: 人们把发现夏威夷的功劳归于库克。
sentences.en: Cook is credited with discovering Hawaii.

sentences.cn: 全世界的科学家都在努力寻找治疗艾滋病的方法。
sentences.en: Scientists around the world are working to discover a cure for AIDS.

sentences.cn: 警方搜查这栋房子时发现里面藏有一大批毒品。
sentences.en: Police discovered a large stash of drugs while searching the house.

sentences.cn: 她发现他们已经逃跑了。
sentences.en: She discovered that they'd escaped...

sentences.cn: 我发现自己怀孕了。
sentences.en: I discovered I was pregnant...

sentences.cn: 几天后，他的尸体在城外的路边被发现，身上有被严重殴打过的痕迹。
sentences.en: A few days later his badly beaten body was discovered on a roadside outside the city.

sentences.cn: 第一个发现美洲大陆的欧洲人
sentences.en: ...the first European to discover America...

sentences.cn: 19 世纪时，在加利福尼亚发现了金子。
sentences.en: In the 19th century, gold was discovered in California...

sentences.cn: 我要是早点接触到摄影技术就好了。
sentences.en: I wish I'd discovered photography when I was younger...

sentences.cn: 体验私人游艇的乐趣和奢华。
sentences.en: Discover the delights and luxury of a private yacht.

sentences.cn: 甲壳虫乐队于20世纪60年代初为世人所知。
sentences.en: The Beatles were discovered in the early 1960's.

sentences.cn: 但就像律师了解到的, 中国对司法改革仍然有限制.
sentences.en: But as lawyers here discover, there are limits to China's embrace of judicial reform.

sentences.cn: 但是当你抬头一看,你会发现许多小雨滴.
sentences.en: But when you lift your head and discover the rain drops.

sentences.cn: 我需要几周的时间了解情况后,才能对公司的未来作出决定.
sentences.en: I'll need several weeks to discover the lie of the land before I can make any decisions about the future of the business.

sentences.cn: 但大脑研究人员发现，当我们有意识地培养新习惯时，就会在大脑中形成相应的（神经）通路，甚至创造出全新的脑细胞，这可以使我们的思维跳跃到新的创新轨道。
sentences.en: But brain researchers have discovered that when we consciously develop new habits, we create parallel paths, and even entirely new brain cells, that can jump our trains of thought onto new, innovative tracks.

sentences.cn: 20世纪60年代晚期，研究人员就发现人类天生具备以四种主要方式解决问题的能力：分析法、流程法、关联（协作）法和创新法。
sentences.en: Researchers in the late 1960 discovered that humans are born with the capacity to approach challenges in four primary ways: analytically, procedurally, relationally (or collaboratively) and innovatively.

sentences.cn: 大多数考古遗址都是通过仔细探索才得以定位，其余才是偶尔被发现的。
sentences.en: Most archaeological sites have been located by means of careful searching, while many others have been discovered by accident.

sentences.cn: [F] 然而，大多数考古遗址都是由寻找它们的考古学家发现。
sentences.en: [F] Most archaeological sites, however, are discovered by archaeologists who have set out to look for them.

sentences.cn: 为了满足日益增长的需求，各类服务正在涌现，使在线上发布研究成果更加便利，也让其他研究人员能够发现并引用它们。
sentences.en: To match the growing demand, services are springing up to make it easier to publish research products online and enable other researchers to discover and cite them.
sentences.from: 17年6月六级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 比如，一位芝加哥女士发现，每天和同事一起吃午餐 的 话 一 年 要 花 费 2,000美元。
sentences.en: One Chicago woman,  for  example,  discovered  that daily  lunches  with  coworkers  cost  her  2,000  dollars  a  year
sentences.from: 16年12月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 来自美国地质调查局的地质学家托马斯•鲍恩说：“这是目前发现的唯——条古埃及的铺面道路。”
sentences.en: “It is the only paved road discovered in ancient Egypt,’’ said geologist Thomas Bown of the United States Geological Survey
sentences.from: 18年6月六级真题(第二套)| 听力

sentences.cn: 这条公路是在距离开罗西南大约45英里处的法尤姆洼地被发现的。
sentences.en: The road was discovered in the Faiyum Depression，about 45 miles southwest of Cairo
sentences.from: 18年6月六级真题(第二套)| 听力

sentences.cn: 显然，这条公路是为了服务新发现的采石场而建造的。
sentences.en: The road was clearly built to provide services for the newly discovered stone pit
sentences.from: 18年6月六级真题(第二套)| 听力

sentences.cn: 我很快发现，这个问题的一个答案在于人们如何看待他们失败的原因。
sentences.en: One answer, I soon  discovered, lay in people’s beliefs about why they had failed.
sentences.from: 16年12月四级真题（第二套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 在挖掘中国中原地区一处遗址的两个探方时，科学家们发现了瓶瓶罐罐的碎片。
sentences.en: While digging two pits at a site in the central plains of China,scientists discovered fragments from pots and vessels.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 首先，她尝试锻炼身体和控制饮食，她因此减掉了一些体重并发现了一种内在力量。
sentences.en: First trying physical exercise and dieting, she lost some weight and discovered an inner strength.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第二套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 有一项针对120 个高级主管团队的研究，研究发现，不到10% 的成员认可自己的团队伙伴。
sentences.en: In a study of 120 teams of senior executives, he discovered that less than 10% of their supposed members agreed on who exactly was on the team.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 科学家在巴哈马的一座偏远岛屿上发现了新物种的蛇。
sentences.en: A new species of snake has been discovered on a remote island in the Bahamas.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 对这一发现进行评论时，密尔沃基自然历史博物馆的蛇类专家Robert Henderson说：“全世界对蛙类新物种的发现和描述比较频繁。”
sentences.en: Commenting on the find, snake expert Robert Henderson, from the Milwaukee Museum of Natural History, said: “Worldwide new species of frogs are being discovered and described quite regularly.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 不要担心, 总有一天我会报复的.
sentences.en: Don't worry, I'm going to get even some day.

sentences.cn: 如果她撞见你在读她的日记, 她会大发雷霆.
sentences.en: If she meets or discover by chance that you read her diary, she can be furious.

sentences.cn: 我撞见他们在偷我的苹果.
sentences.en: I meet or discover by chance that they are stolening my apple.

sentences.cn: 我撞见他在吻我的妻子.
sentences.en: I discovered him kissing my wife.

sentences.cn: 我们试图帮助每个学生发现获得知识的欢乐和充实.
sentences.en: We seek to help every student discover the joy and fulfillment in the obtainment of knowledge.

sentences.cn: 获得知识: 如通过观察或研究来获得知识.
sentences.en: Discover: To obtain knowledge of, as through observation or study.

Sentence.sentence: In a study of 120 teams of senior executives, he discovered that less than 10% of their supposed members agreed on who exactly was on the team.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: First trying physical exercise and dieting, she lost some weight and discovered an inner strength.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: A new species of snake has been discovered on a remote island in the Bahamas.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: By following individuals over time, Salthouse said, we gain insight in cognition changes, and may possibly discover ways to slow the rate of decline.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But it’s one of many low- tech fixes for high-tech failures that people without engineering degrees have discovered, often out of desperation and shared.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Why do some students give up when they encounter difficulty, whereas others who are no more skilled continue to strive and learn? One answer, I soon discovered, lay in people's beliefs about why they had failed.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Social workers discover that the wife normally tries to take care of her husband herself for as long as she can in order not to use up their life savings.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Part of your point you knew before hand but part you discovered as you wrote.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Although no form of matter yet discovered moves as fast as or faster than light, scientific experiments have already confirmed that accelerated motion causes a traveler's time to be stretched
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: He has discovered it – babies don't even know that language exists – and he has found out how it works and learnt to use it appropriately.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: By following individuals over time," Salthouse said, "we gain insight in cognition changes, and may possibly discover ways to slow the rate of decline."
Sentence.come: 2016年6月四级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C
